item.title: 即使特朗普加剧滞胀困境，国债仍是避险首选
item.description: 由于担心唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易战会引发全球经济衰退，受到惊吓的投资者纷纷涌入美国国债市场；至少目前，他们忽略了同样的惩罚性关税可能会引发新一轮通胀的风险。【原文：Shell-shocked investors are piling into US Treasuries on concern that Donald Trump’s trade war will trigger a worldwide recession — ignoring for now, at least, the risk that the same punitive tariffs may unleash another bout of inflation.】

item.title: 特斯拉大牛以马斯克和特朗普为由将目标股价下调 43
item.description: 华尔街最看好特斯拉公司的分析师之一将其目标股价下调了 43%，理由是首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易政策造成了品牌危机。【原文：One of Wall Street’s most bullish Tesla Inc. analysts slashed his price target for the stock by 43%, citing a brand crisis created by Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk and US President Donald Trump’s trade policies.】

item.title: 在总检察长邦迪的保证下，苹果公司将 TikTok 保留在其商店中
item.description: 在得到特朗普政府的保证后，苹果公司将在其美国应用程序商店中保留 ByteDance Ltd. 的 TikTok 和其他应用程序至少 75 天。【原文：Apple Inc., following assurances from the Trump administration, is keeping TikTok and other apps from ByteDance Ltd. on its US App Store for at least another 75 days.】

item.title: 法国勒庞在集会上告诉支持者她将继续战斗
item.description: 玛丽娜-勒庞在巴黎告诉支持者，她将继续与她所称的 "政治性 "法院裁决作斗争，该裁决暂时禁止她竞选总统。【原文：Marine Le Pen told supporters in Paris she’ll keep fighting what she described as a “political” court ruling that has barred her — for now — from running for president.】

item.title: 威廉与魔兽》电影开画票房达 1.57 亿美元，创 2025 年迄今最佳纪录
item.description: 根据同名视频游戏改编的华纳兄弟探索公司电影《威廉与魔兽》（A Minecraft Movie）本周末在美国和加拿大影院上映，排名第一，成为今年首映场次最多的电影。【原文：A Minecraft Movie, a Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. film based on the namesake video game, opened at No. 1 in US and Canadian theaters this weekend, marking the biggest debut for a film this year.】

item.title: 南非领导人认为增值税上调替代方案前景黯淡
item.description: 南非总统西里尔-拉马福萨（Cyril Ramaphosa）表示，国家财政部正在研究避免提高增值税的所有方案，但避免提高增值税的前景黯淡。【原文：South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said the National Treasury is looking at all options to avoid having to raise value-added tax but that the prospects for escaping such an increase are dim.】

item.title: Evercore ISI 是华尔街最新一家下调 S&P 500 目标值的公司
item.description: 由于贸易战担忧升级，S&P 500 指数在短短两天内抹去了 5.4 万亿美元的市值，Evercore ISI 与其他华尔街公司一样，表示其 2025 年目标过于乐观，但仍认为股市将在年底前从目前的水平反弹。【原文：After the S&P 500 Index wiped out $5.4 trillion in market value in just two days on escalating trade war fears, Evercore ISI is joining other Wall Street firms in saying it was too optimistic in its 2025 targets — but still sees stocks rallying from current levels by year-end.】

item.title: 萨默斯警告说，5.4 万亿美元的损失之后，未来将出现更多动荡
item.description: 前财政部长劳伦斯-萨默斯（Lawrence Summers）在 X 周日的一篇文章中写道，未来市场很有可能会出现更多类似周四和周五的动荡。【原文：There’s a good chance that markets will see more turbulence ahead similar to what happened on Thursday and Friday, former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers wrote in a post on X Sunday.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》称英国将撤销 300 家机构以削减成本
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》报道，作为首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）削减成本努力的一部分，英国政府正在考虑撤销或合并 300 多个机构。【原文：The UK government is considering scrapping or merging over 300 agencies as part of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s effort to cut costs, according to a report in the Financial Times.】

item.title: 巴里克黄金公司提议更名以反映其铜矿业务的发展
item.description: 世界第二大黄金生产商巴里克黄金公司（Barrick Gold Corp.【原文：Barrick Gold Corp., the world’s No. 2 gold producer, has proposed dropping “gold” from its name as it expand its copper mining operations.】

item.title: 贝森特在拒绝美国经济衰退的同时，发出了蔑视关税的声音
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周日在全球金融市场因美国新关税而大幅抛售的情况下发出了挑衅的声音，认为新关税是必要的，并拒绝接受新关税将导致美国经济衰退的观点。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Sunday struck a defiant tone in the face of global financial markets selling off sharply in response to new US tariffs, arguing the new duties were necessary and rejecting the idea that they would cause a US recession.】

item.title: 马来西亚推动协调东南亚关税对策
item.description: 马来西亚总理安瓦尔-易卜拉欣（Anwar Ibrahim）表示，马来西亚将牵头协调东南亚地区对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普关税的反应。【原文：Malaysia will lead efforts to coordinate a regional response in Southeast Asia toward US President Donald Trump’s tariffs, the country’s Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said.】

item.title: 股票价格日内波动幅度加大催生期权策略
item.description: 从二月份开始的股市下滑在上周加速，其特点不仅是日间大幅波动，而且是日内波动加剧。【原文：The stock slide that started in February and accelerated last week has been marked not just by large day-to-day moves, but also by an increase in intraday volatility.】

item.title: 在特朗普采取行动后，越南提出取消对美国的所有关税
item.description: 根据越南共产党 4 月 5 日的一封信，在唐纳德-特朗普宣布对这个东南亚国家征收 46%的关税后，越南提出取消对美国进口产品的所有关税。【原文：Vietnam has offered to remove all tariffs on US imports after Donald Trump announced a 46% levy on the southeast Asian nation, according to an April 5 letter from Vietnam’s communist party.】

item.title: 全球降息押注为新兴市场投资者提供躲避特朗普混战的避风港
item.description: 对全球利率下降的押注正吸引着新兴市场投资者前来寻求避开美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战所引发的波动。【原文：Bets on falling global interest rates are attracting emerging market investors seeking shelter from the volatility sparked by President Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 苹果 iPhone 在美国有可能涨价
item.description: 在多年避免 iPhone 在美国涨价之后，苹果公司最终可能被迫涨价。此外：iPhone 17 的设计初具雏形；公司的智能家居中枢仍在不断变化；在 WWDC 召开之前发布首个 iOS 18.5 测试版。【原文：After years of avoiding iPhone price hikes in the US, Apple could finally be forced to to make increases. Also: The iPhone 17’s design takes shape; the company’s smart home hub remains in flux; and the first iOS 18.5 beta version is released ahead of WWDC.】

item.title: 沙特出人意料地提高石油产量后连日下调亚洲油价
item.description: 就在欧佩克+（OPEC+）联盟宣布出人意料地大幅增产几天后，沙特阿拉伯将其旗舰油价下调了两年多来的最大幅度。【原文：Saudi Arabia slashed its flagship oil price by the most in more than two years, just days after the OPEC+ alliance announced an unexpectedly large output hike.】

item.title: 台湾收紧卖空规则以平息关税带来的市场波动
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）咄咄逼人的关税政策下，台湾金融监管机构宣布加强卖空管制，以稳定市场。【原文：Taiwan’s financial regulator has announced tighter short-selling controls to stabilize the market amid Donald Trump’s aggressive tariffs.】

item.title: 德国公共部门工人赢得 5.8% 的交错式工资增长
item.description: 在与雇主进行的三轮谈判未能取得结果的情况下，仲裁员进行了干预，德国公共部门的工人获得了 5.8%的工资增长，并将分两批发放。【原文：German public-sector workers secured a 5.8% wage increase, to be awarded in two tranches, after arbitrators intervened when three rounds of negotiations with employers failed to produce a result.】

item.title: 尼日利亚提供美元以保护奈拉免受关税影响
item.description: 在美国关税动荡引发抛售之后，尼日利亚央行向贷款人出售美元，以阻止奈拉汇率的下跌。【原文：Nigeria’s central bank sold dollars to lenders to stem an erosion of the naira exchange rate, after a selloff induced by US tariff turbulence.】

item.title: 印度将重点关注贸易协议，避免对美国关税进行报复
item.description: 据一位印度政府官员称，印度不太可能立即对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普征收关税进行报复，印度正集中精力与美国谈判双边贸易协议，以降低关税。【原文：India is unlikely to immediately retaliate against President Donald Trump’s tariff imposition, and is focusing efforts on negotiating a bilateral trade deal with the US to bring down duties, according to a Indian government official.】

item.title: 中东股市因石油和关税冲击遭遇 2020 年以来最惨重跌势
item.description: 由于投资者对全球贸易战和油价低迷的双重威胁做出了反应，包括沙特阿拉伯在内的中东国家主要股票基准在周日创下了 2020 年以来的最大跌幅。【原文：Main equity benchmarks in Middle East countries including Saudi Arabia sank the most since 2020 on Sunday as investors reacted to the dual threats of a global trade war and depressed oil prices.】

item.title: Meta 宣布发布新的 Llama 4 人工智能模型
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司宣布推出新的 Llama 4 人工智能模型，使用户能够构建更加个性化的 "多模态 "体验。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. announced the release of its new Llama 4 artificial intelligence models that allow users to build more personalized “multimodal” experiences.】

item.title: 斯塔默誓言采取措施支持英国企业应对关税威胁
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）表示，在唐纳德-特朗普的关税威胁下，他将于本周宣布支持英国经济和企业的措施。【原文：UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he’ll announce measures this week to support Britain’s economy and businesses amid the threat posed by Donald Trump’s tariffs.】

item.title: 香港财务总监称关税威胁全球贸易
item.description: 香港财政司司长陈茂波周日在一篇博客文章中说，美国的关税破坏了国际贸易，并将最终伤害美国人。【原文：US tariffs undermine international trade and will ultimately hurt Americans, Hong Kong Financial Secretary Paul Chan said in a blog post Sunday.】

item.title: 不要出卖英国儿童作为关税谈判筹码
item.description:
英国政府正在考虑重新审议《网络安全法案》，以此作为对唐纳德-特朗普的让步。这将是一个错误。【原文：

The UK government is considering reviewing the Online Safety Act as a concession to Donald Trump. That would be a mistake.

】

item.title: 英国公司可从特朗普关税中获得竞争优势
item.description: 经济学家认为，唐纳德-特朗普对英国出口产品的优惠待遇为英国企业带来了竞争优势，可以保护英国经济免受华盛顿贸易战最严重影响。【原文：Donald Trump’s preferential treatment of British exports gives the country’s firms a competitive advantage that could protect the economy from the worst of Washington’s trade war, according to economists.】

item.title: 中国投资者为美国关税报复的 "丑陋 "周一做好准备
item.description: 随着中国市场结束了一个漫长的周末，并考虑到对美国关税的报复，中国投资者正准备迎接一个严峻的周一。【原文：China investors are bracing for a grim Monday as the nation’s markets return from an extended weekend and factor in its retaliation to US tariffs.】

item.title: 基辅市长称俄罗斯发动导弹袭击，基辅发生爆炸
item.description: 基辅市市长维塔利-克里琴科（Vitali Klitschko）说，俄罗斯对基辅发动了导弹袭击，更多的射弹正在逼近。【原文：Russia launched a missile attack on Kyiv, and more of the projectiles are approaching, the city’s mayor Vitali Klitschko said.】

item.title: 美国加征关税前越南第一季度经济增长放缓
item.description: 越南第一季度的经济增长速度低于经济学家的预测，因为该国正准备应对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁未来增长的 46%关税。【原文：Vietnam’s economy expanded slower than economists’ forecast in the first quarter as the country braces for Donald Trump’s 46% tariff that threatens future growth.】
